intro: Haplostylis minor, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by follicles containing the seeds. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
